The flatbreads soaked up NONE of the sauce! They were so dense and thin, so you end up folding the bread and basically scooping up the sauce like a spoon.   Small details - otherwise, a great spot for brunch.

photos.caption: Photo of or, The Whale - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Shakshuka. Perfect flavour, sauce a little thin

UbhFYYgtwpQKXkVBtQ3c6A.text: Swept up into OTW on a Thursday afternoon for brunch.  MONKEY BREAD ($6): After seeing everyone else rave about the monkey bread and that it was MUST GET, we were excited to try it. Unfortunately, it was really dry and we told the server which he did address (thank you so much guy with the red tattoo on his arm!!). SWEET BUBBLE WAFFLE ($12): This was some crazy fiesta on my plate of fruits and whipped cream and syrup. I do wish that they had the maple syrup on the side though, the waffle could've gotten soggy so I had to eat a bit faster than normal (I'm a slow eater, lol). I would like to try the savory bubble or chef's breakfast next time!  One thing I didn't like was the lighting. It was really dark inside although it was around 1PM. I thought that there would be some more natural lighting but the restaurant is down some stairs, with the front doors being quite a bit far, not allowing a lot of light (hence my dark photo).

photos.caption: Photo of or, The Whale - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. No shell left behind~
Photo of or, The Whale - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Monkey bread $6
Photo of or, The Whale - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Sweet bubble waffle $12

_hMjeF5eihHDonqdB2ZAhg.text: We came here for my birthday dinner this year and let's just say once is enough. The food and presentation were good but the portions, prices and narrow selection just aren't for me. I was surprised there weren't as many seafood items on the menu for it being a fish restaurant!  We ordered the oysters Rockefeller and they were the most delicious way of oysters I've ever had. Free bread or biscuits or something would have been great but nope. Our waiter was not very responsive but some of the others were very friendly.   I did like that the bathrooms were super clean, nice and in a completely separate area. For an impatient 15-mo baby, that proved to be a good place for a breather. Oh yeah, there was no sign for the restaurant and I had no idea it was inside a hotel. No street parking either so we had to pay to get in this tiny lot next door. Please make the sign visible for guests!

vI0tJZRLYQ8MsASoX5chfQ.text: It's great restaurant for brunch. Its decor is wonderful with its nautical feel, clean finishes, and lots of light. It felt trendy, cool, and lively. More importantly, there is a good selection of fun food options. My quick breakdown: - Yes to the monkey bread! - Fries had a delicious homemade ketchup. - Steak and eggs over the savory waffle (but if you can, get both :)). I say this because the steak was just cooked so perfectly and my sweet tooth just craved for a fluffy sweet waffle. But that being said, the savory waffle was still tasty, just denser than a fluffy belgian waffle, and the sausage served with the waffle was the standout.

OPbHr3wz_zjCTnHaGVEfrQ.text: We made brunch reservations here for a Sunday afternoon at 1pm.  We took the parkway getting here and got off at the Grant street exit and it's right there on the corner.  I drove around and found a parking garage right next to the hotel that this restaurant is in for $6.  You go to the front of the hotel and walk in.  Once you walk in their hostess for the restaurant is to your right.  We were greeted and took a walk downstairs to our table.       We got our seats in the middle of the floor which wasn't too bad.  The area is a little different.  You almost feel like your in the middle of a big hotel lobby but it wasn't bad.         We had already looked through their brunch menu but I still wasn't sure what I wanted still.  I was really hungry and we were going to go for drinks after so I wanted to make sure I was full.  I looked through pictures on Yelp and finally decided on the Savory Waffle.  The waitress describe it to me and with my wife's encouragement I went with it.       We both ordered waters and my wife got a coffee which was just ok.  Carrie got the eggs benny and it looked good.  The problem was that the eggs were underdone.  They looked ok at first but once she ate it she could tell they were a little under.  We should have had them redo the eggs when we noticed but we didn't. So that was disappointing but my savory waffles were awesome!  I was thinking it might be sweet but I didn't want something sweet.  I just wanted a lot of food.  It wasn't sweet because the waffle was made out of cornmeal and there was just a light maple sauce.  The waffle, sausage, eggs, bacon all came together so beautifully.  I loved it and it hit the spot.         So overall a decent brunch but it would have been really good if my wife's eggs were cooked better.  Also the service was really good I thought too.  Our waitress did a good job taking care of us.

photos.caption: Photo of or, The Whale - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Savory Waffle

WhQFpGCJs9swZ-w4zUSLcQ.text: My husband and I had our 1st anniversary dinner here and it was a 5 star experience from start to finish! We arrived a bit early and enjoyed some great custom cocktails at the bar before being led to our table downstairs. The atmosphere here is on point! I love the details.  Our meal was incredible! The oysters were great and I had some of the best scallops I've ever eaten.

LDH0zcddoSIWM5rWbye9CA.text: Had a fantastic meal at this restaurant. The food tasted great and was impeccably presented. The bar had a long list of  cocktails, many of which were tried and were well received. The service was excellent throughout the meal.   The others at my table all had great meals as well. We will definitely be going back.

photos.caption: Photo of or, The Whale - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Mushroom gnocchi
Photo of or, The Whale - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Steak and frittes
Photo of or, The Whale - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Roasted oysters

SEf6CDy6Mlb-4P6Gb9fe2w.text: The bartenders staff are amazing especially Nami- I love her drinks, she's very helpful with giving us pointers to good restaurants, and they have a very creative list of cocktails. I like to engage in conversations w bartenders and they all are very friendly. Big corporations need to learn how to train and hire staff like this. I've been to Michelin Star Restaurants when the staff did not come back n ask if I need something or a second drink. This is top notch service.  This will be the bar I return to when I'm in Pittsburgh again.

photos.caption: Photo of or, The Whale - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Japaneseme
Photo of or, The Whale - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. House G&amp;T

UkRWb3glqDoX61u0FOQJ1Q.text: At least the drinks were good...long wait for all meals at a relatively quiet time...  Undercooked chicken (& waffles) that was served late because it "needed to be cooked a bit more" at first... gritty hollandaise and cold steak and eggs...  Quite a shame really! At least the server was apologetic   Brunch is clearly not their forte.

yRimAelI1CdTs2uzBm4FLw.text: This may be my new favorite spot in the city. It's hard to find a casual place that still has some class, with superb food and service. Or, the Whale hit all of the marks. We went for our anniversary and had a great experience. We started with a cheese plate that had some surprising and tasty pairings. For dinner, I had the scallops and my husband had New York Strip - everything was cooked perfectly. Our server was excellent and we loved the atmosphere.

photos.caption: Photo of or, The Whale - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Scallops - seared perfectly!
Photo of or, The Whale - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. New York Strip with herb butter - perfect!

2rso4Yy4DON3UGPnbfJY3w.text: We had a great time at The Whale! Everyone on staff was fantastic and extra kudos to Cindy, our waitress as well as the hostess. Cindy was so patient and polite. She was very knowledgeable and made great suggestions. The hostess was also very patient and helped us get a table that met our needs including a wheelchair, high chair and our big stroller.   The food was so good. Get the Monkey Bread!!  We'll be back again soon!

hawq9xEZxENhWptkJvhW9Q.text: We met up with friends here before a Pens game.  The place is very nice and it's on the lower level of a cool historic building.  The food is quite good and you can tell it's prepared well with fresh ingredients.  The 4 of us shared a $200 steak.  Yea .... you read that correctly.  Don't get me wrong, it was phenomenal  ..... but for $200 I was kind of hoping it came with a lap dance.  That would not have amused my wife in the least bit .... but it would have gotten that coveted 5th star!

6QoFLGmguB7tmFRdBKuMrQ.text: Cocktails were great. Service was phenomenal and my cheeseboard was to die for!!!! A little pricey but it was a special occasion so worth it in the end. Olive was a friendly and personable server. Creme brulee was delicious!!!

7yaEyAG09oYop90oASVHyA.text: Service was great but the food is overpriced and fair to poor quality. The menu vaguely describes the entrees.

idaKkoMXM1F5Y36q2n7wcQ.text: I don't know who gave this place 4 stars but they're delusional.   Pittsburgh has several of the best new restaurants in the country. This is not one of them.   The place is seafood themed but they had only two fish selections on the menu.  We settled for something else and every item we ordered was sub-par and overpriced.  If you want to compete in the high-end Pittsburgh restaurant market, you have to do better that this.

RxZNlwRUoGnY_K51AAgdRw.text: Whoa, what a breakfast. Portland has nothing (that I've tried) that compares to the herb baked eggs here. I was pretty hungry and cold, so there might be a little bias there. I'm sad I'm leaving Pittsburgh today and didn't eat here sooner. Also, outstanding service!

lueu8nOLSq026k2BP1L2SA.text: Outstanding birthday dinner here on a snowy and cold Sunday night.  We started in the bar section and I got one of their signature drinks with bourbon.  it was nice, albeit a bit strong.  I followed it up with a cosmo which I don't think anyone has ordered in like 15 years, but they did a great job.  My third drink was a flirtini and I had to explain how to make it and they were spot on.  Props for making a drink on the fly to the bartending staff.  I ended the evening with a decaf coffee which I was not impressed with.  Not sure what was wrong with it, but it just didn't taste right.  For starters, we had the Hollywood oysters.  I hadn't ever heard of this type before, but the waitress's explanation of briney with a cucumber finish was precise.  I then had the cod chowder.  The broth is mixed in at the table and was outstanding.  Fingerling potatoes and a lovely piece of cod finished it off.  Zach got the wedge salad which was excellent but came in this ridiculously large wooden bowl.  I get it, it was cute, but way too big.  I then had the cockles and linguine.  I would be lying if I didn't just get this because they talk about cockles in Game of Thrones and I had never eaten them.  They are very similar to clams, but have a slightly different flavor.  This came with a light cream sauce and sea beans which are very salty and I was instructed to mix them in.  It was delicious if you like salty things, which I do.  Zach got the fish stew and wow, spicy!  Good, but spicy.  We finished off the meal with the apple tart and ice cream.  The crust was so buttery and outstanding.   I definitely want to come back for another dinner to try one of the towers and for brunch which sounds delicious.  Fabulous fish addition to Pittsburgh!

jc59bwYJvJL3yKviNrcHlQ.text: The decor and ambiance was great! However it went downhill from there. This place is overrated to say the least. Bloody Mary's were watery and took 20 minutes to get to our table. The monkey bread everyone raved about was so dry. Crab cake Benedict was drowning in hollandaise and don't get me wrong I love a good hollandaise but this was way too much. The English muffin was dry. Crab cakes were decent, but the poached eggs were so under cooked the whites were running everywhere. My fiance got the steak and eggs, it was a bad cut of meat for a place that displays all of their steaks behind glass. Also it wasn't rested so it bled all over his plate. For a higher end brunch this was very disappointing.

3nlcOaeme2V4XRxsTSXf9Q.text: My three-year-old son wanted to take the train into the city so my wife and I decided to grab a meal. We decided on Or, the Whale Because it was close to her work though we realized that it was an upscale place. It was a little hard to find but the ambience was fantastic. We got the cod chowder for an appetizer. My wife got the seafood stew and I went for the scallop with butternut puree.  So there is no formal kids menu yet, they told us that it was in the works. They gave us a Fantastic number of options that were given in a four piece sectional plates. My daughter chose the grilled cheese and my son had the pasta with vegetables with Yogurt and cookie. Everything was fantastic. The service was excellent. The cocktails were tasty. This is definitely one of my favorite places in Pittsburgh.

1PMCMybY5yL4GqlL67rO_g.text: Beautiful restaurant designed in the theme of the original book Moby Dick by Herman Melville. Service was really attentive and the wedge salad was above and beyond expectations. Shrimp and Crab Cocktail can be shared and I was pleased with the Steak Frites. Valet car service available along with adjacent DISTRIKT HOTEL P I T T S B U R G H! Take a peek at the hotel lobby and you will be impressed by the renovations of Salvation Army Building built in 1924.

eDjufin8IDSulSor-zIxkA.text: Really good green salad and scallop entree.  Service was attentive.  Local beer selection was good.  Pound cake dessert was excellent.  My only reservation is that entree portion was very small given its price.

4fxVG405jG5dtEuFaWySMA.text: We dined at Or, The Whale this evening and throughly enjoyed our meal.  We were celebrating my parents wedding anniversary.  Ryan, our waiter did a super job. Despite many reviews, citing slow/poor service, our meal was perfectly paced.  The entrees were delicious.  We ordered the flounder, salmon, scallops and ribeye.  Valet parking is available.

FApeOCAhjXb7OtgeViFNRQ.text: oh, disappointing: Great "packaging "- nice decor, design, even the menu is wonderfully written. But apparently the marketing department didn't talk to the kitchen. Went for brunch- The "quinoa granola", note to self warning- first ingredient - Greek (not) yogurt, is a bowl of yogurt, not granola, or even muesli style granola with listed chia, flax seed, etc, and berries not found in serving. We ordered the "cereal", with instructions to bring the egg plates as a second course. Not. They all arrived at once, eliminating any chance of hot eggs. Got the manager involved, who assured us after our concerns about leaving the fresh food on a warming table, that the dishes would be prepared and cooked fresh. Not. They arrived, plates hot from the warmer, food cold, except top layer. Top it off, the selections - crab cake Benedict and baked herbed eggs- just not very good. And why spoil a good bloody Mary with good scotch whisky? Two goods don't make a better. Manager did comp some of meal, but that doesn't make up for a miserable meal, really. Patron beware. Truly unfortunate.

uhcC29icTl_mnlr_A_YI6Q.text: I had Shakshuka and it was really good but they have best drinks...will go there again

kX94Td7vHg2FOy-DL7twSA.text: Good restaurant with a fun menu. However, I recently attended for a rooftop yoga class they were promoting despite the fact that they did not have a teacher organized for that date - kind of a frustrating that they continued to promote the event despite the teacher being on a planned vacation. I would expect a higher level of service excellence from a restaurant and hotel that positions itself as they do. If you are attending any special events, I encourage you to call in advance to confirm the event is happening.

9dU9Ro4uUSTXQXELBxUcyA.text: We picked this place to celebrate my boyfriend's birthday and we're glad we did. :) The environment was cozy and the staff was super friendly. We started with half dozen oysters; definitely some of the better ones we've had in town. For entrees, he order the clam bake and I got the scallops. The clam bake had some uniquely delicious flavors, but some of the clams were not as fresh, unfortunately. The dayboat scallops, on the other hand, were absolutely deciduous - definitely the highlight of the meal! While we waited for our desserts, the staff surprised us with a birthday cake! That's how we ended up eating three desserts for the night. :P Overall it was a great experience, and we'd definitely recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of or, The Whale - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. They surprised him with a birthday cake! How sweet! :)
Photo of or, The Whale - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Clam bake

wdasWwj8HLp5nLMTXWvblg.text: You absolutely must have the fries at some point, I have no idea what kind of crazy voodoo shit they do to them but they are the best I've ever had! Make sure to ask for Nami the bartender and let her craft some crazy concoctions for you!

6Fb9P20iZ5c6mxynWjP9Bw.text: Had the Savory Bubble waffle. It was at least as good as I was expecting and probably more. Good portion of food. The bacon had an excellent smoke flavor and corn meal waffle was different, in a good way. The whole thing was delicious. She had the Herb Baked Egg. It too was delicious (for the first few minutes she was Mmm-ing with every bite). It tasted very good but would probably be too rich for me, I'm sure I wouldn't be able to finish that. Price was more than I'd normally pay for brunch but it was a nice splurge and well worth the price for something you're not going to find at most brunch places.

WnPj1QMvPNPPkKVPRWXsmg.text: This place is A-ok indeed. Parking wasn't the easiest but not the worst either. I had a roasted chicken salad and fresh OJ- all were pretty solid. The service definitely left something to be desired, but they're still new and working kinks out I'm sure. The decor is classy too.

W8YEzPWJdfsUel4H9PqlbA.text: Our new favorite Pittsburgh brunch spot!  Great decor, friendly and attentive staff all around. We started with the monkey bread, a real treat for the table. The savory bubble waffle offered a filling combination of flavors and textures that was unexpected and different than anything our well-brunched family has had elsewhere. The American breakfast offers perfectly cooked bacon and sausage, eggs to order, grilled break and well-seasoned fingerling potatoes with just the right amount of crisp. We will definitely be back.

MAvTBkQ74fYrKv5LA79AUw.text: This place was so wonderful, comfortable, clean and the service was lovely. You walk in from the outside ground floor of the Distrikt Hotel on the Boulevard and as soon as you walk in your immediately aware that this place is upscale and chic but cozy. The restaurant is downstairs and the bar is upstairs in the back. We made reservations but it was a slower evening. I'd definitely wear at least a polo and jeans. The food was SO good and their cocktail menu has something for everyone as well as a large book of fine wines. The menu is broken up into surf, turf, sides and apps. All sides are separate but only like 8 bucks or less. Get the mushrooms!!!  The mural is beautiful on the back wall. And all the seating is leather. Parking garage right down the street less than a block away! Go here and you won't be disappointed.   They change the menu for each season. For splitting an appetizer, getting a cocktail, a bread tray, a side and an entree I paid $62.00 before tipping.

IfB2Or7O3XMewEa7HWkaDQ.text: We just left or The Whale. I must say I was very disappointed with my meal. The service was friendly but slow. It's a smaller restaurant so for the amount of patrons being served I'm not sure why the service was slow.   We started with the bread board appetizer. It's a pretty simple appetizer and took about 30 mins to get served. We ordered two filets medium rare and the rib eye medium rare. My daughters steak was a perfect medium rare and mine was almost well done. You can't charge someone $53 for a steak and over cook it. I don't mind paying for GOOD food. I have a hard time paying a lot of money for food that is not good. Sorry I won't come back or recommend or The Whale.

nLLKQUQVn1GSGslVkh_hyQ.text: May I just say that our man Andy was a superb waiter who worked to serve us 20 minutes after the restaurant closed. And our food was simply sublime.  We arrived at about 930 (restaurant closes at 1000), but they let us in anyway. It's not a giant restaurant, but it has ample seating and warm lighting that makes it feel intimate. The kitchen is open so you can see everything.   My daughter and I decided to get a variety of small plates and share. We got the smashed potatoes, garlic puree and baguette, lobster bisque, and the crab cakes. Well let me tell you, everything was just top notch. The garlic puree was solid. Nothing too crazy, but something really nice to balance out the decadence of the rest of our meal. The garlic itself was done well, without any hint of bitterness. The smashed potatoes were seasoned just perfectly. If you've had roasted potatoes before and are always having to salt them, you know what I mean. The potatoes in this dish had a beautiful crispy skin, and were salted exactly right. Every single potato was done perfectly. Every. One. It was like they came from potato heaven. And the crab cakes. Wow. The serving is 4 good sized crab cakes, with what seemed to be absolutely no filler and a beautiful crisp outside. This dish was also flavored very well and paired nicely with the potatoes. The crab cakes were topped with some dainty fresh greens and a red pepper remoulade.   But the piece de resistance was far and away the lobster bisque. The dish comes with the lobster cous cous and the tempura lobster tail already in the bowl. Then Andy comes over and pours the amazing lobster bisque all over the cous cous and the tempura. And then you have MAGIC. Now I have made cous cous before but my cous cous has never tasted like that. Like ever. Every single bit of that cous cous was filled with beautiful flavor and was perfectly done - no sticky mess here. The tempura was crispy on the outside and sweet and juicy on the inside - absolutely no amount of toughness at all. And the bisque. Oh mama the bisque. Just a beautiful beautiful pairing of textures and flavors. This presentation really made use of all those lovely lobster bits allowing each bit to just shine, while simultaneously preventing that sort of sameness that can overwhelm a dish even when the flavor profile is good. Really, there are not enough words to describe this bisque.   This lovely restaurant is located right at the entrance of the Distrikt Hotel Pittsburgh on Boulevard is the Allies. If you don't want to park in the hotel there is a public parking facility about two buildings down that is relatively reasonable at dinner. This restaurant is beautiful to eat in, has lovely committed staff, and serves food that is simply inspired. You must go.

photos.caption: Photo of or, The Whale - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Lobster bisque, smashed potatoes, garlic purée and baguette, crab cakes. Best dinner ever.

tyNfeurxjc2Na3eKz8ju4w.text: Everything was perfect and a nice date night! We enjoyed ourself and had wonderful professional service! We even went to the roof to watch the sunset! Had to take a picture of the inside the elevator! I just loved the steel "artwork" and had to take a picture!

photos.caption: Photo of or, The Whale - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

shs7x2FDha9lbOZtaW81Ag.text: We had dinner reservations but ended up eating at the bar because our bartender Tal was a delight. Amazing drinks (especially the garden party!) and all the food we had was incredibly flavorful and delicious.  Our friend had been a bunch of times so was able to give us the skinny on which dishes to get.  Some standouts were the charred octopus, trio of duck and the grilled Caesar salad (which was big enough to share with 3 people) although my most favorite thing we ate was the crab Mac n cheese.  It was so full of huge chunks of crab I just couldn't believe it.    Hubby, of course had to get the braised lamb neck which was done perfectly.  Our friend got the red snapper and wow - the skin was nice and crispy but the fish itself was tender and flavorful.  My scallops were huge and tasty - the bacon jam paired with it was perfect.   I really enjoyed the food - it was a bit pricey especially because a lot of it is a la cart but worth it for a nice night out.

photos.caption: Photo of or, The Whale - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Braised Lamb neck
Photo of or, The Whale - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Scallops with beet purée and bacon jam
Photo of or, The Whale - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Red snapper

H7WC2Ff9scncsDLQKWu19Q.text: We were staying at the Distrikt Hotel so we decided to check this place out for dinner.   Oysters (4/5): good oysters, but we only ordered a 1/2 dozen and received a dozen which we were charged for even though the waitress admitted to incorrectly pushing the wrong button. Definitely wouldn't fly in CA.   Garden Party (5/5): refreshing and yummy cocktail.   Roasted Salad (3/5): just okay, the dressing was mayo-ish which was weird.   Cod Chowder (4/5): unique and good, but could have a thinner consistency.   Crab Mac and Cheese (3/5): nothing special about it, would recommend ordering something else.   Overall we had a nice dinner, would've given it 4 stars if we didn't get charged for the dozen oysters we didn't order.

photos.caption: Photo of or, The Whale - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Crab mac
Photo of or, The Whale - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Cod chowder
Photo of or, The Whale - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

z80TZWanwQRTcu-LmaSTSw.text: Solid meal at a reasonable price point relative to quality and atmosphere. Here are the details: * bread basket appetizer. Three different kinds of tasty, fresh bread. Definitely recommended. * Side of mushrooms. Solid, nothing special. * Shrimp scampi. Fresh, quality shrimp. But didnt really stand out. It was ok. * Salmon. Tasty, fresh, and high quality fish. The accompanyments were well-chosen. I would order it again. * Charred ceasar salad. Someone else in my party ordered it and didnt like it but I dont think they understood what they were getting. I'm not a Ceasar salad person * cod chowder. I cant really comment because I didnt sample it as it had bacon in it. * bread pudding dessert. Very tasty, definitely something I'd recommend and order again. It is a large piece.  So, considering all that, I'd say it is four stars. The service was solid though I think our server paid a little less attention once she saw we weren't ordering any alcohol.

AZXAtG4GfYWpzB2x6MeP2A.text: Enjoyed our time here! It's a fun and trendy place. Service is good. However, the descriptions of food are off. See the attached photo

photos.caption: Photo of or, The Whale - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Fun and trendy place. Just beware if you order the Caesar salad.

WBiKOvdlyxk81nDL4-ASkA.text: I was so pleased to discover this amazing restaurant was in my hotel while in Pittsburgh recently.  On a super rainy night it was quite lovely to just head downstairs.  And what a meal!  A great oyster selection, wonderful shrimp cocktail.  The staff is really lovely and welcoming, offering suggestions and making sure your wine glass is never empty :) The decor is quite interesting too, such a lively space!  I'd love to come back if my work travel returns me to Pittsburgh!

T4RIJhVcDWYHUK-01hoqmw.text: I loved my trip to Or, The Whale with a friend for my birthday. We stopped in early before our reservation for a drink and hopped up to the decorative bar in the back of the restaurant. The bar was really cool because of its location above the majority of the restaurant on the level below. The rope decor that cascaded over the bar and draped down from the ceiling into the dining area tied together the nautical theme of the restaurant without being overdone.   I ordered the Garden Party and enjoyed the citrusy flavor of the drink. Not too boozy at all, but definitely had a kick. I appreciated the herbal notes of chamomile, lavender, and elderflower.   When we sat down for our reservation (which at first didn't seem necessary, but definitely was needed as the night went on--so call ahead people!), we were quickly greeted by our waiter, who was knowledgable but not overly friendly. My friend and I decided to strategically attack the menu--trying as many dishes as possible.   We ended up ordering a cheese plate, the bread board, and the clams casino to start. The cheese plate was one of the best that I've had. All of the cheeses were delicious and the pairings were varied yet complimentary to multiple of the different cheeses. I appreciated how the multitude of flavors easily mixed and matched with each other. The bread board was good (which was especially important because we had to pay for it); I preferred the sourdough over the black pepper biscuits. The clams casino were yummy, but definitely didn't blow me away. I was hoping for something more exciting because the dish is a classic that's becoming a bit tired. I wanted to see it reinvented.   For our second round we ordered the mussels, the crab mac and cheese, and some OTW fries. The mussels were phenomenal, and I appreciated the fact that they came with some grilled french bread to sop up the sauce (I can never have enough bread with mussels, though). The crab mac and cheese was unbelievably rich, but so goooooood. It was a large portion for a side order, so I definitely recommend splitting it. And unless you're a fan of incredibly rich food, I wouldn't order it as your meal unless you want cheese and cream overload. (Now that I say that, that really doesn't sound like a terrible thing...) If you order the OTW fries you will not be disappointed. The portion is HUUUUUUGE and the fries are seasoned perfectly. Definitely a good pairing with the mussels.   To wrap up our meal we ordered two desserts to share, of course: the chevre cheesecake dessert and the chocolate peanut butter lava cake. Both were divine! I loved having them right next to each other because the tartness of the cheesecake cut right through the lava cake. I was alternating bites and was pleased every time!  Or, The Whale is a great spot! I loved the food and enjoyed the atmosphere and service. Looking forward to my next visit!

tBLNRH8Hx_dd33jFmskpfQ.text: Or, The Whale is one of those farm to table places I hear about and want to try but then never think of when I'm wondering where I should go since I'm not often downtown for lunch or dinner.  But one day when looking for a nice breakfast/brunch spot in town to take my friend on a Saturday morning, this seemed like a good choice.  One thing I like about Or, The Whale is the earlier hours on Saturday.  Most places don't open for brunch until 10am but here they open at 9am (I'm more of a morning person).  The interior is an open space with seating around the upstairs area where you first walk in from Boulevard of the Allies.  Downstairs near the open kitchen and wood-fired grill is more seating.  Or, The Whale is located just next to the Distrikt Hotel in the old Salvation Army building (specifically in the renovated gymnasium).  There's a feeling of both comfort and luxury.  And that includes the service and food.  My friend ordered the shrimp and grits and a side of grilled bread which she enjoyed very much.  But not nearly as much as the breakfast poutine that tasted even better than I had hoped.  And just because, I decided to also order the chai cinnamon roll for breakfast dessert.  The combination of savory and sweet made this a marvelous brunch that I won't forget.    I may return to Or, The Whale for lunch and/or dinner.  But that brunch experience is definitely worth going back for.

photos.caption: Photo of or, The Whale - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chai Cinnamon roll
Photo of or, The Whale - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Breakfast Poutine

n_nntNXKeVje6lOxwmKccg.text: Or, The Whale gets good scores for all categories, including atmosphere, service, and food preparation and presentation. I was again disappointed with the wine offering, which is purposely limited to obscure bottles with prices that are probably too high, but you have no way to be sure. It's a limited menu place, like the many others in this category (think Union Standard, Acorn, Siempre Algo). These are high quality restaurants, but also indistinguishable. They don't inspire return visits, particularly because of the limited menus. I wish all of them well, but we surely don't need all of them.

E9IwOvo-Pz8nHJ5ufaz_tA.text: Last night I enjoyed a wonderful dinner here for a girlfriend's birthday. We always try to do it big for this one night a year, and OTW was the perfect spot this year.   We were greeted by a very friendly hostess who offered a free coat check! Is it just me, or is there truly nothing better in the dead of winter?!  We had reservations for 5:30 and went early to have a drink at the bar. I loved the ambiance of their bar (the whole restaurant actually!) and they were super accommodating. We enjoyed the Garden Party cocktail and the tequila drink with a red wine float that I can't remember the name of but would absolutely recommend! Shortly after, we went back to the hostess stand and they took us to our table. It got really busy, so a reservation seemed like the way to go.   We ended up sharing several apps and sides throughout the evening. We started with the cheese and bread plates and they were phenomenal. Each cheese was served with a different sauce or jam and paired beautifully with the crisps it was served on. We then moved to the mussels and clams casino which were both fabulous. I loved the mussel sauce. Finally, we finished with OTW fries and the crab Mac n cheese. The fries were a huge portion but I can't say enough about how yummy they were. The crab Mac left me wanting more, but my friend loved it. Throughout the night, we drank wine based on the manager's recommendations and they were wonderful.   Of course, we had to end the night with TWO desserts: cheesecake and the chocolate peanut butter lava cake. WOW. they stole the show!   Overall, the atmosphere is really cool and I loved the open kitchen. Our service was good but not exceptional,  but I can't wait to go back!

Qq687cIfjSjMbH6JHKKT8Q.text: My wife and I had lunch here on Friday.This place is special. First of all my wife loves anything about a whale then they have a restaurant.  The place is small. It's located in a hotel. The food was delicious. The lunch menu is small. The price for lunch is a little more sleep than other places in the city. The prices are on for other hotel restaurants.  The service was excellent. Now there was us and 2 other people. Maybe that's why it was super. I want to come back for dinner. I will update my review based in my dinner experience.

UMTe5qR-eHoLCf7XdxVLvA.text: I was really impressed! Our food was cooked perfectly and had amazing taste. The waitress was very nice and helpful. Just a bit over priced. Coffee was alright, nothing different than the normal cheap coffee for restaurants. The food itself was worth it and I would definitely go again

gLDHdx0YQoHZAmfc5OeiWg.text: The moment you walk in your greeted with an amazing atmosphere that seems to calm you down but give a sense of comfort with nice modern music playing in the background and an open kitchen to hear the chef do his craft. The attention to detail here is amazing, you'll have to ask of the background of the restaurant to know what I mean  We started with the Dry Aged Beef Tartare, which in all my Tartare tastings has been the best to date, definitely a great starter, and yes two pieces of bread is enough! My main course was the Lamb Neck, now I'm no fan usually of lamb but I'm glad I had went with this, it was perfection with the meat falling off the bone and so tender. Certainly will be coming back!

ybqen9cMPlsAuVkbxRJZQw.text: Had the duck trio as an app and shared the pork chop and crab Mac and cheese. The service was superb! Sat at the bar and both bartenders were attentive and knew their drinks. I would definitely stop by here and try more of the menu items! I also had one of the custom cocktails called the Palumas so delicious !!

srZ0LQxJJhFLAvfJ_wWVdA.text: My friend and I came here while on a work trip to Pittsburgh, and we had a great dinner. The restaurant is really beautifully decorated with a great atmosphere. The service was excellent.  To drink, my friend had a draft rose ale, and I had a draft saison, both of which were really good. We each got the Wild Mushroom (PA wild forged mushroom, Parisienne gnocchi, and mushroom broth) which was really delicious. My friend thought it was lacking seasoning, so she asked for additional salt and pepper. The portion was the perfect size.  Overall, a pretty solid dining experience.

chcH9rrpFrHgJ4eL1_kRew.text: Stayed at the Distrikt hotel and received vouchers to have breakfast at Or, The Whale.... (I am a Hilton Diamond Elite member) service was horrible the first day, got the eggs Benny, which was ok but drowning in Hollandaise Sauce. My gf hated the server and was annoyed they had no artificial sweeteners. The place felt pretentious but it was a complimentary breakfast.  The next morning, we waited 5-7 minutes to be acknowledged, THE PLACE WAS EMPTY, we were told there was a lot of reservations, but we can sit at the bar. We were ignored at the bar for about 10 minutes, we then asked what we can order with our vouchers, the waitress didn't know and didn't offer us anything to drink. She then asked her manager about the menu and he seemed to ignore her.... 10 minutes later I have a angry girlfriend who walked out and then I walked out and no one acknowledged that we left, even though we walked by the manager and waitress.

photos.caption: Photo of or, The Whale - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

QEFBt-ayFyDIPuBEK8r-gQ.text: Phenomenal multi level farm to table restaurant located inside The Distriket hotel in downtown Pittsburgh. My fiance and I came here the other night for a date night and were very pleased. We couldn't believe it took us so long to give this place a try. We had a reservation but arrived early so went straight to the bar. Bar wraps all the way around so there is a good bit of space. The main entrance leads you to the upstairs and that's where the bar is located. You can look down to the bottom level of the restaurant which is beautifully decorated with lots of bright lighting. The bartenders served us immediately. They know their stuff and whipped up amazing cocktails. I had the garden party which was a refreshing mix of vodka and Prosecco. Cocktails and wine range in price form $10-$15 which is a tad expensive but the cocktails are great quality. I would totally come back and just sit at the bar next time for cocktails and apps.   Service was amazing. We had a fabulous server who made sure we were well taken care of. She was also very knowledge about the menu as well as beer, wine, and cocktail pairings with the food. She was constantly refilling our water. I wish I could remember her name anyway she gets 5 stars!   We started out with the steak tartare and cheese board. Steak tartare was full of flavor and served with grilled bread. For the cheese board you can choose 3 or 5 cheeses. We chose 3 and it was the perfect amount. The cheeses change all the time so you may get something different next time. Each cheese had a honey/glaze to dip and each one paired so well. My fiance had the pork chop which he raved about. The meat was cooked perfectly. I had the salmon succotash and was so happy with my choice. It had such a hearty flavor and the portion was just right not too big or small. I would absolutely get it again, such a unique dish. We also got the French Fries as they were recommended by the bartender...wow! Perfectly crisp and fresh and served with homemade ketchup. Best fries I ever had. For dessert we opted for the peanut butter lava cake which is perfection! It's to die for and you must try it, chocolate and peanut better what's not to love. I will be back to try the crab Mac it looked so good but I had no more room.   I absolutely recommend Or, the whale if you're staying at the hotel or just for a night out.

1wLkOvXf2ZrwUlXAr8bifQ.text: We're staying in Pittsburgh for the short film festival, and stopped in for brunch at the recommendation of the concierge of the Distrikt Hotel next door. The space was lovely with lots of nice, ambient touches. I'm a book nerd, so I particularly enjoyed all of the literary + nautical touches. But all of that is just window dressing and doesn't matter at all if the food doesn't deliver. Luckily ... it did.   We had the savory waffles -- with hollandaise and maple syrup, bacon, sausage, egg, and potatoes. It was a mountain of breakfast deliciousness, the perfect balance of savory and sweet. My kiddo -- who is three and enjoyed getting to spy on the cooking, looking into the open kitchen from the top level -- got the oatmeal, which was so tasty. Topped with caramelized bananas and fresh blackberries, it was amongst the most impressive oatmeal dishes I've ever seen.   The service was awesome -- our waitress Stephanie made some great recommendations of where we might take our toddler to play nearby -- and even stopped us on our way out the door with a last minute idea.   Thank you for the great experience!

jsbKmseB6Q4uvi3i5wN97A.text: Cayman from Cleveland for the weekend and stayed at The Distrikt... Ate at the Whale..Great experience, great food, and great recommendations from Damiano... Really knowledgeable server and does a superior job.

y0Ba4BtPiRAd29Vh020VKQ.text: You rarely can go wrong when ordering an "American breakfast"-two eggs any way you like them, a choice of meat, toast and potatoes. With this entree you got both bacon and sausage score!  The scrambled eggs were good, the potatoes solid plus the sausage was fantastic and had a nice spicy kick to it.  The grilled bread was tasty and they had a homemade jam you can ask for.  I did not leave hungry! The menu had a lot of good choices. A few in our party started with the monkey bread and it was a warm, sugary delight. It was all a bit pricy but what can you expect at a hotel restaurant.  Our waitress was great and loved the decor.

VDVEvY1asnugSk20bdLARA.text: So wanted to love this place & excited to get Saturday night reservations for my LA friends, we did NOT have a good experience at all. It started with the cold greeting at the door.  When being led to our table we realized its a two-level open restaurant so being upstairs is like a balcony and you hear everything on the lower level. And not just murmurs, the noise is magnified. There was a large party with squeals and over the top laughter & yelling that was deafening upstairs. It was so bad that we almost left but when we spoke to a manager about moving tables, we were told they would be leaving very soon. So we ordered food and it was as slow coming to the table as the drinks when we first sat down. And regarding drinks, my friend ordered a glass of wine, and it was clearly from a bottle that had been opened for a long time, and her concern was then confirmed by the waitress. For more than an hour and a half, we suffered through the extreme noise, adding to it by yelling across the small table to have a conversation through the appetizers, a selection of cheeses, salads and main courses.  We could finally hear when finishing our dinner and through dessert, as the whole restaurant seemed to clear out at once at what seemed early too. So with the cold greeting and a painfully shy waitress who though nice, did not have good timing or responses to questions, the person in charge never came back to check on us even when the noise settled. We know that management can't kick out this party, but politely asking them to tone down the screaming would have been appropriate or tend to the other customers suffering. It seemed there was no concern about the effect on everyone else's experience. The couple next to us even commented on hoping the noise would settle soon for us as they were leaving.  In the end, I wanted to look for something good about the evening: the valet had my car waiting when we exited and opened all of our doors. Big check/Big disappointment.

IqSncsDafFyXV_o-ncrTTg.text: Food was good but over priced-this is Pittsburgh not NYC. The sommelier was impressive and made a great recommendation. Our appetizers were great but our entrees were unimpressive. My husband had monkfish which was completely overpowered by parsnips (and he is a fan of parsnips). I had the cockles and pasta which I was not a fan of. It lacked acidity. We also ordered cocktails and were served an overload of sugar. I only gave this place three stars because the sommelier was top notch.

1zQeNvyad3Msj8th1VvvNg.text: It was nice but I would probably not go out of my way to take anyone there for brunch. I would say just try it out if you are in the area but don't go out if your way. I just didn't get completely wowed with my meal and my friend with me left in an utter rage and would probably give one star if she used yelp. She got the eggs benny and her eggs were extremely runny and her salad had no dressing on it at all. She described it as dry leaves on her plate. My meal was okay but it was cold, purposely but I didn't know I was being served a non heated meal. It was hard boiled eggs, cold, mildly fatty ham, flavorless cheese, dried apricots, some pickled mix of stuff I didn't know what it was and a few small wedges of very chewy bread. I would not order the chefs breakfast again. I also would never order the eggs benny (what my friend ordered). The positives were that that restaurant is well themed and very nice to look at. Another negative was that the bartender took the sugar for my friends coffee away and gave it to the couple next to us without asking and never offered to return it even tho my friend got another coffee. The blood Mary was tasty but when the drink is as much as your breakfast I wouldn't order more than one! It was $10 - which I suppose is fine but the food should have been better.

Ddc0mPZVMt08xc4n3ROxnw.text: Amazing ambiance! My house G&T that Michelle recommended was so refreshing with a grapefruit garnish. Will definitely be coming back for more!

photos.caption: Photo of or, The Whale - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

z_G1WmwsXq63Mt5vCm-hNw.text: My wife and I just went here, and we have very mixed feelings about it. Both of us were really excited to try this place after reading so many positive articles and reviews. We were impressed when first walked in, immediately noticing the amazing mural on the back wall of the restaurant featuring Moby Dick (hence the name of the place). We checked our coats, gave them the name of our reservation, and the hostess sat us. Once seated we noticed that tables were quite long, causing people sitting across from each other to have to talk louder than normal, making the overall volume of the restaurant pretty loud, which was unexpected. We ordered some cocktails, both of which were good, but at $14 a piece, definitely weren't some of the best drinks that we have had in the city. We ordered two appetizers, the mussels and the octopus. The mussels were good, but we really wish we would have tried them before we ate the octopus, because it was by far the best octopus we have ever had. It was incredibly tender and covered in a delightfully salty chimichurri. The biggest downside was I was expecting more than one 4" tentacle for the price. Again, the mussels were quite good, very large, and a good portion but taste wise couldn't hold up to the octopus. Then we waited for our entrees. And we waited. And we waited. Several times our waitress came up and apologized for the delay and that it shouldn't be much longer. Well, at the 1.5 hour mark we asked if she could find out how much longer it would be. Within a few min they brought them out. My wife ordered a short rib pasta and I ordered the scallops. Hers was a decent portion size, and had a great overall flavor although it was very salty. My scallops were great, but the portion size was minimal. It consisted of 3 fifty cent piece size scallops with maybe 6 home made potato chips. Once we got our check we let our waitress know that we in no way thought the delay was her fault, but if she could let her manager know that the wait was very disappointing. A moment later she came back to our table and said that the manger would be stopping by our table before she ran the check. Another 15 min passed before the manger was finally able to stop by. He was very nice and apologetic, and took a round of drinks off of bill. Neither him, nor our waitress, were able to tell us why our food took so long, just that they were sorry.  Overall most of the food was good, but beyond the octopus, I feel we could get better elsewhere and with it currently being one of the most expensive restaurants in Pittsburgh we just expected more. If I was just reviewing the food I probably would have given it 4 stars, good but not great. It definitely lost a star for the ridiculous amount of time it took to get our food.

4qYD6n7qEKUAogi_D-DPYQ.text: I have no words to describe this place! The food is next level delicious. I've been in a  thorough search for the best eggs Benedict in town (I'm new in Pittsburgh) and I got the eggs Chesapeake here and they immediately became my new favorite all time brunch meal. My friends and I shared the dark chocolate mousse and the creme brulee and they were PERFECT. Apart from the amazing food and the beautiful navy decoration, the service was incredible! I asked for tea and Our lovely server, Cindy, brought us a full tray of the different teas they have. She also gave us a full description of every plate/drink we ordered. She was very attentive, helpful and sweet and made our brunch an even better experience. This is our new FAVORITE BRUNCH PLACE. And the great deal is that they have it 7 days a week!!  Thank you Or, the Whale for helping me complete my brunch research.

Sb54fOJH8f-WHyUJGAGXLQ.text: Not my favorite brunch in Pittsburgh. The savory waffle came with potatoes and bacon piled on top of the cornmeal waffle drenched in sauce. So much sauce it made the farm fresh bacon sloppy and chewy the entire dish inedible. Also the shakshuka was bland and served with extremely crunchy burned triangles of pitas. The dish should have been served with actual soft pita bread on the side so you could use it to eat the food! The 6 meals my friends and I had were sub par and we were very disappointed in what we had. The best part of the meal was the MONKEY BREAD! That was the bomb!

HbCZUdkSj0V_CPVI67FmhA.text: We went here for brunch not long after it opened. The host was very nice and accommodating. Our server took great care of us. The Moby Dick theme was charming. The menu is broken down in to "chapters" like a novel. I had the chef's breakfast, which arrived on a charcuterie board. Hard boiled eggs, speck, mostarda, dried apricots, grilled bread, and cheddar. Everything was delicious and the portion was just right. Or, the whale is located in the brand new Distrikt hotel. They have valet service but we were able to find street parking a short walk from the restaurant. I'm excited to visit this new addition to downtown Pittsburgh again very soon.
